metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130: Out of the Depths

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of total spiritual bankruptcy and 'primordial catastrophe'.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
the God who pursues us even beyond the grave
the love that persists in breaking through our resistance
he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (The Trinity as the source of Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church / The Hearer
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver (the one in the 'depths').

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit (Fellowship)
tekstueel_bewijs: last drop of the blood of the Son
love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the power that 'pours forth'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity, and self-will
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human totally unable to stand.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'fear of the Lord' as a result of being found by Grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The 'Watchman'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (confession/fear) is only possible because the primary program (forgiveness) has already been initiated by God.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Trinity → Redemption → The Miserable Offender
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Blood of Christ → God the Father ← The Primordial Catastrophe

voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
understand what is meant here by the fear of the Lord
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human *non-pouvoir* (inability) met by God's *pouvoir* (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Depths) to ~S2 (Honest confession) to S1 (Plenteous redemption).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Fear of the Lord' which paradoxically flows from Forgiveness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon laments the removal of 'miserable offenders' from the liturgy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects human performance and locates the 'engine' of the story in God's nature.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The idea that we can add up our virtues... is decisively repudiated

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/mentors are used as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of God, but the sermon explicitly states they are insufficient and often fail.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by moving from Paul's agony to God's Trinitarian love.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of Psalm 130 to the 'radiance' of the Trinity is logically and theologically tight.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The fellowship of the Holy Spirit; being brought into the inner life of the Trinity.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'fellowship' that humans cannot manufacture.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'primordial catastrophe' and 'estrangement'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is robustly theocentric. God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by grounding human love in the prior reality of the Trinity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the parent-child pathos; Greimas reveals that the parent is merely a 'Helper' actant pointing to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' actually functions to deliver grace to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' is a modal competence (Savoir/Pouvoir) gifted by the Sender, not a work produced by the Subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (spends, bears, believes, hopes, endures, loves, pursues, adores, gives, redeems)
We (erred, strayed, followed, offended, left undone, offer worship)
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses the 'miserable offender' language to intensify the Opponent, thereby magnifying the Subject's (God's) victory.
